result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Douglas Brantner

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:32 PM Defendant Michael Douglas Brantner in court.  Attorney Jens Hubert Loberg appeared by video for Michael Douglas Brantner.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Loberg has filed a form, waiver of PH rights.  Mr. Brantner signed the form on 8/10/22.  Court advises defendant of right to PH.  Mr. Brantner understands and waives his right to PH.  Court finds Mr. Brantner kvi waives his statutory right to PH.  State to file an Information within 30 days.  Mr. Seifert informs the Information will mere the complaint.  Mr. Loberg wishes to proceed with arraignment today.  Court explains the official charging document of an Information which will be a duplicate of the complaint.  Court advises of the charges that will be in the Information/max. penalties and rights.  NGP entered on all counts.  Attorney Loberg requests STC in 2 months and may turn into sentencing hearing.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Letter to Judge with PH Waiver & request to appear remotely on 8/23/2022
Attorney Loberg's Request to appear by phone approved.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:31 PM Defendant Michael Douglas Brantner in courtroom.  Attorney Jens Hubert Loberg appeared by video for Michael Douglas Brantner.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Position for PH.  Attorney Loberg waives time limits and schedule PH at court's convenience.  If parties request, Court will grant zoom and an agreement by stipulation Mr. Michael Brantner be identified by zoom for witness testimony.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Letter to Judge from Attorney Loberg Re: conflict for 7/19/22

Adjustment Number: 22A 002845,
Payable Number: 35750,
Receipt Number: 22R 000863,
Amount: $20.00
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report - Attorney Appointment Status
No possession or consumption of alcohol or entering bars or taverns if released.

1:42 PM Defendant Michael Douglas Brantner appeared by video from the PCJ.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  State addresses bond, Mr. Brantner is local and first time he's charged with a felony and ask for $1000 cash bond.  No possess or consume alcohol or enter into bars or taverns.  Defendant asks for a signature bond, has no $1000 and won't assume alcohol and stay out of taverns if do a signature bond.  State believes he's completed probation or probation was revoked and don't think he's currently on paper.  Court is familiar with you and these charges have significant consequences and Court grants $1000 cash bond.  Refrain from possessing or consuming alcohol or entering bars or taverns if released.  The hearing will be in person if bond posted.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
